pages.text: Heliotrope is one of the new types of resources found in this world?$(br)Somehow the Nether seems connected to the Overworld...$(br)We do not currently know how it got here, but we know that it can be used to $(#f00)"corrupt" $()certain blocks.
As implied, this is the Heliotrope Ore. It can be found virtually anywhere in the Nether.

This is the most common source of Heliotrope. Scattered around the world are Geodes containing these little guys. $(br)Upon breaking one without a Silk Touch pickaxe, you will be rewarded a singular piece of dust.

Heliotrope dust is the main product of smelting $(item)Heliotrope Ore$() and the byproduct of destroying $(item)Heliotrope Clusters$(). Since our smelting methods are still inefficient, it is recommended to keep the ore until more efficient ways of smelting and extracting are found. $(br)As for the clusters, unless mined carefully, they will always drop dust when broken.
